sentence.text: ` The Author ! " he snorted , out loud , mocking himself .
` It 's rubbish , " Tremayne snorted .
` Beautiful , " Agnes snorted .
` Am I ready for the Eddie ? " he snorted .
` You do n't have to tell me that ! " she snorted .
` I never liked that fella , " Billy snorted .
` Really , " the Doctor snorted .
` Another fifteen years and maybe , " the Doctor snorted .
` That she will , " Ratagan snorted .
` Fine , fine , " snorted Teeny .
` How perfectly ridiculous ! " snorted the Trunchbull .
` And how it escaped ! " snorted Sir Trevor Chambers .
` Not long enough , " snorted the governor .
` Spontaneous combustion you 'll suggest next , " snorted Samuel .
` Do n't you ` good woman " me ! " snorted the outraged dame .
` Pah ! " snorted Araminta .
` They just put those bits in to make you think you 're really getting meat , " snorted Billy , ` You know , like eggshells in the war . "
` Him again , " snorted Ken .
` Ah " , snorted the author triumphantly , ` then you still have another 160 pages of closely packed erudition to come " .

` Thank you , " snorted Clare in as ungrateful a manner as she could manage , swept her copy contemptuously off the desk , and stalked out of the room with a moderately successful attempt at dignity .
` This time round , " snorts Paul protectively , ` the press could n't even get the name of the studio right .
Maiden indeed , she snorted to herself .
` Keep at the back ? " her godmother snorted in disbelief .
` Darnton , " came the reply and the king snorted back : ` More like Darnton i " th' dirt " , before harrumphing back to bed .
